bibl.title: Entertaining Theseus and Heracles: The Hecale and the Victoria Berenices as a Diptych.
bibl.note: 1. The Hecale and the Victoria Berenices as a diptych. - 2. The Hecale as a 'tragedy', the Victoria Berenices as a 'comedy' or 'satyr-play'. - 3. Theseus in the Hecale and Heracles in the Victoria Berenices. - 4. The hospitality scenes of the Hecale and the Victoria Berenices as adaptations of the Odyssey. - 5. Theseus and Heracles as (willy-nilly) modest guests: a metapoetic reading.
bibl.seg: AMBÜHL Annemarie, Entertaining Theseus and Heracles: The Hecale and the Victoria Berenices as a Diptych.
M.A. HARDER, R.F. REGTUIT and G.C. WAKKER (Edd.), Callimachus II = Hellenistica Groningana. 7 (Leuven, 2004) pp. 23-47.

1. The Hecale and the Victoria Berenices as a diptych. - 2. The Hecale as a 'tragedy', the Victoria Berenices as a 'comedy' or 'satyr-play'. - 3. Theseus in the Hecale and Heracles in the Victoria Berenices. - 4. The hospitality scenes of the Hecale and the Victoria Berenices as adaptations of the Odyssey. - 5. Theseus and Heracles as (willy-nilly) modest guests: a metapoetic reading.
